about_the_game:
Journey back to the rollicking heyday of Colorado narrow-gauge railroading and take the throttle of diminutive but potent 2-6-0 “Mogul” steam locomotives as they battle Rocky Mountain grades!

Created by Machine Rail, this remarkable Add-On brings to Train Simulator historic narrow-gauge steam locomotives constructed by Cooke Locomotive & Machine Works in the 1880’s for the legendary Denver, South Park & Pacific Railroad. And the captivating locomotives are crafted in exacting detail, feature multiple versions, and wear eye-catching liveries.

Among the rollcall of fabled American narrow-gauge railroads, the Denver, South Park & Pacific – the South Park Line -- stood tall. Constructed in the 1870s and 1880s, the railroad extended west from Denver along the South Platte River, then climbed via Kenosha Pass into the heart of Colorado’s rough and tumble mining district. DSP&P’s slim steel rails reached to renowned Leadville and, via Alpine Tunnel at an elevation of more than 11,500 feet, to Gunnison, Colorado. Later controlled by the Union Pacific and renamed the Denver, Leadville & Gunnison, the narrow-gauge line became part of the Colorado & Southern Railway in 1899.

Featured in this remarkable Train Simulator pack are DSP&P 2-6-0s constructed by Cooke, a predecessor of the American Locomotive Works (Alco). DSP&P 2-6-0s 71 and 72 carry their original road numbers, while Mogul No. 110 wears its D&LG road number (it was originally DSP&P No. 40). These memorable locomotives were among a group of eight 2-6-0s purchased from Cooke by the DSP&P in 1884. The 70-series engines are equipped with vintage Congdon stacks and No. 71 is provided in both original its livery and a colorful fictional blue livery, while handsome 2-6-0 No. 110 features a straight stack and factory livery.

Machine Rail has masterfully modeled these remarkable and classic locomotives with extraordinary detail and authenticity. Fashioned from original blueprint specifications, the locomotives feature authentic cab and operating controls, external and internal animations, authentic sounds, realistic water and fuel consumption, working lights and smokebox door, and selectable details such as flags on the pilots.

To put the stylish little Moguls to work, this pack also includes scenarios on the period-appropriate and popular Train Simulator Clear Creek Narrow Gauge Route (like the DSP&P, the Clear Creek route was destined to become part of the Colorado & Southern Railway).

Among the great and memorable experiences of railroading, few could match that of diminutive narrow-gauge steam locomotives battling the towering American Rockies – and you can enjoy it all, from inside the cab with throttle in hand, with the DSP&P Moguls from Machine Rail!

Included Scenarios

Two standard scenarios featuring the DSP&P Moguls on the Train Clear Creek Narrow Gauge Route (route available separately) are included:

  • [MR] #01 - The First Run [1/2]
  • [MR] #02 - Teared Apart [2/2]

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Denver, South Park & Pacific Cooke narrow-gauge 2-6-0 Mogul steam locomotives
  • Multiple detail and livery variations
  • DSP&P No. 71 in original factory livery
  • DSP&P No. 71 in fictional blue livery
  • DSP&P No.72 with Congdon stack
  • DSP&P (DL&G) No.110 with straight stack
  • Based on original blueprint specifications
  • External and internal animations
  • Realistic water and fuel consumption
  • Authentic sounds
  • Authentic cab
  • Working lights
  • Working smokebox door
  • Selectable details
  • Scenarios on the Train Simulator Clear Creek Narrow Gauge Route
  • Quick Drive Compatible
  • Download size: 318.1MB

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
